But it immediately proclaims itself as unique by the bright yellow paint job and the replica Statue of Liberty statue outside the office, many dolphin statues, creative tile work, and is a study in bohemian decorations. The building, pool area, and grounds are immaculate. There isn't even time for sand to be tracked into the beach access causeway between rooms before it is swept away! The room we used contradicted the exterior design. All of the fixtures and furnishings in the room were sparkling clean and new. We especially liked: 1. Private beach access 2. Cleanliness 3. Good air conditioning 4. Location 3 miles from frantic city center 5. Sweet manager who seems to care about guests and hotel 6. COLD refrigerator that kept canned sodas frosty 7. Cigarette-smoking happy dolphin overlooking pool 8. Yellow "home base" is easy to find again from the beach 9. 10% off with room key at Denny's across the street 10. Easy free parking 11. Security (room safes, special room locks, well-lit grounds) I recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a sane stay - neither chaotic nor boring - in crazy Daytona Beach during spring break.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Inn was rude even when I made the reservation”
Reviews.Author: florida111
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a small Florida hotel and Dream Inn looked perfect. We made our reservation online and received our confirmation. Then a representative from the hotel called us, wanting us to sign a form which she would fax to us to guarantee that we would pay for our stay. We thought this a little unusual since we had already booked online with a credit card. We didn't receive the fax, and since our reservation was in two days, we didn't think much about it. We received another phone call from the inn the day before our reservation. Again, they wanted to know where the fax was. When we explained that we hadn't received it, it became confusing as to whether we had a reservation or not. In addition, since it was a weekend day, there was no way for them to fax us another form without great inconvenience for us, since we have no fax machine at home. The experience put us off. The lady from the Inn was confrontational and patronizing in her tone, making it hard for us to imagine being comfortable in her hotel. It just didn't seem like a good way to treat a customer. In the end we cancelled our reservation and went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Best... Dream Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Freeum
Reviews.Content: Carrie and All, This is the best place I've found to stay in Daytona Beach...I just wanted to tell you what a great time we had at the Dream Inn..the rooms were wonderful, the staff fantastic, and the weather, perfect. Dream Inn has a real "Florida of Yesterday" quality that is so lacking in the mega Hotels and Resorts. I'd come again in a "heartbeat" and actually plan on another stay in the near future. My thanks to you all for a memorable vacation. SIncerely, L Gagne

Reviews.Title: “great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: julielutton
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at the Dream Inn in Aug. 06 for 4 nites. I had stayed at this property before but it had been several years ago. We found the room spotless and very nicely appointed.The bed was very comfy(this is very important to us) The grounds were in great condition. The pool was very clean and we really enjoyed all the lounge chairs and palapas in the pool area. The pool area overlooks the beach. This property is small and does not have a restaurant or lounge but that is no problem for us as we like to go out for meals on vacation. The room had a refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker. We purchased snacks and drinks and just relaxed and really enjoyed ourselves. The staff was helpful with any request and took care of requests very very quickly. I am a travel agent and can be hard to please but if you want a small intimate clean property with great service this is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dream Inn June 4th thru June 7th, 2006 and loved the motel. The rooms are very clean and the staff is wonderful. We loved the small, intimate feel of the motel next to other giant impersonal hotels. The grounds were beautifully done and we felt like we were in a tropical retreat. We look forward to staying there again as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Something to remember”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was fabulous, I had a lot of things to remember ….

Reviews.Title: “Dream Inn - May 2006”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dream Inn just a few days ago. I read mixed reviews on this site so I wasn't sure what to expect. First of all, we got a great rate - about $55. The rooms were clean, the staff friendly. There is a nice area for relaxing in the sun right on the beach. The pool was small but just fine. It wasn't a luxury resort by any means, but taking into consideration the low rate and size of the resort, we were very happy with the stay. We will stay there again if we make it back to Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice family run motel with a great location close to restaurants and right on the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Low to marginal hotel needs lots of updates.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs lots of items to be updated. Bath and shower faucets barely worked.Towel rack was broken off wall.Rooms very small. Left phone cord in room and staff wanted $25 service charge plus mailing cost to send $2 package.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Inn and think about staying somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: VacationMomFor2
Reviews.Content: We saw pictures of the Dream Inn online and thought it looked like a nice place to stay. The rooms looked nicely kept and tropical and the pictures of the pool made it look inviting. We drove to Florida for Christmas to visit family and had to call the Dream Inn to let them know that we were going to be late for check-in. The woman at the desk said that we could arrive when we wanted but the front desk would be closed after 7 pm. She assured me that our room would be ready and not to worry. She also let me know that since the desk was closed they would LEAVE OUR KEY UNDER THE DOOR MAT!!! Was that a joke? Once we arrived the first thing I thought was get me out of here. And sure enough, our key was under the mat! Anyone could have known that they leave keys under the mat and gone in our room. The room, needless to say, was not tropical. It wasn't even typical. The carpet was dirty and the room had a musty oder. The ceiling was patched up and the bedspread was brown and old. When I called the woman to explain we were unhappy with the room she said they had just updated the decor and that we wouldn't be able to see her until the next morning. Her son was supposedly staying on site to handle any emergencies. They were not willing to refund any money and offered no appologies explaining it was a clean and safe place to sleep. They also explained it was safe since the police often sat in the lot across the street to monitor. We ended up staying at the Days Inn next door, thank God they had an open room.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Place is a dump. Does not look like the facility advertised on their web page, maybe 20 years ago! When we arrived we were very unhappy and the owners weren't interested. They told us we could go somewhere else but we weren't getting a penny back. They were opening the office late, closing early and never around to address any of the problems. Our room was under construction, missing wall tiles, major water leak in the room, carpet was soaked and very bad mildew smell, bathroom sink was clogged, electric outlet in bathroom did not work, smoke detector was missing from room, fire extinguisher was over a year expired, I could go on and on. Their website states "Enjoy southern hospitality by Louisville, KY owners that endear themselves to guests with a brand of charm and personal attention that sets the Dream Inn apart from others" What a CROCK! Trust me, you don't want to stay here, you will regret it immensely. They offer NO REFUNDS no matter how unsatisfied you are and guarantee NOTHING. Days Inn, right next door, would be a much better choice in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Be afraid, be very afraid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. The owners do not honor their stated reservations policies, and have a misleading website, in terms of the accommodations. My dream became a nightmare - I filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: jifjifjif
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very average. Hard tile floors, brick walls inside the rooms. Pool is small. Front desk staff is impossible to get a hold of. Their rules and policies are very strict. Overall, not good at all. For the same cost, you can get a room at the Ocean Walk Resort which is brand new and two steps from everything to do.

Reviews.Title: “All lies! Should be called the Dream On.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Took my wife here for Mothers Day weekend. Cost us a bundle to spend one night checking out early because the place was not what was shown and described on the website or by the owner on the phone. This place is a dump. Was "completely renovated in 2005" so the website says. Nice photos too. Wonder where they took them because it can't have been Dream Inn property. All lies on the website and words on the phone from the owner. We had a jacuzzi suite complete with black mold in the kitchenette and bathroom. Renovation consisted of adding a jacuzzi tub in the small bedroom space and about 10' x 10' of new cheap carpet. We were told we could walk out of the room directly onto the beach. Right, if you go around to the court and down the public access street. When we went to check out explaining we were mislead and didn't appreciate the conditions we were told people were waiting in line for the room we had. Odd we didn't see any of them. WARNING. Don't go here if you like cleanliness, space, polite staff, bang for your buck. Who am I to judge this place? Just a business man who spends about 100 days a year in paid lodging around the continental U.S. I am telling all my friends and even enemies this place should be avoided at all costs. Next renovation should be from the ground up with new ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Dream Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Joasia
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative comments about Dream Inn in Daytona Beach Shores, FL I proceeded very cautiously to make reservations via email - I was quoted $100/night (despite a $69 fall special I saw earlier) and instructed to call Cindy. When I did she gave me a higher price and dismissed the quote I was given saying the correct price is $110. Per their policy (1/2 cost of stay upfront) I sent her a check together with a copy of the emailed quote for $100 saying out of decency they should honor it. She called me when she received the check demanding that I call her back. When I did - in a raised voice she told me I will not teach her how to run her business and inquired if (despite her being unapologetic) I still want to stay there. She said she's The Owner and it's her internal problem that the price keeps going up - NOT the customer's concern. She made it clear who the boss is (called me "honey" but kept talking in a rude raised voice) and pushed me to reconsider...I did and canceled. What a creepy experience!

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive website”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The oceanfront ground floor rooms do not have a private balcony. You have to share it with the room next door. There is a small wall with a large glass window between the balcony and the ocean, which needed washed. My nephew's room faced the pool, oceanfront, but he had a cement picnic table in front of his window that was mostly in use by loud guests. He didn't even open his curtains. Everyone could have seen into his room. The woman owner was rude when I called to get the hotel's local phone #. She said it was on the phone, it wasn't; it was in the hotel's black book; it wasn't. She hung up on me after giving it. There are signs everywhere about charges if you do this or that; not washing dishes, using the dead bolt for a door stop, taking towels, etc. The rooms on the website with the 2 queen beds, oceanfront, are not the rooms on the ground floor that we rented.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Dream Inn is a gorgeous place to stay if you're looking for the complete honeymoon getaway. The jacuzzi in the jacuzzi suite was clean and looked as it did in the magazine pictures. Our suite was right in front of the beach, which was a beautiful oceanfront view. The desk people were rather pleasant and they took care of a couple minor problems within minutes, day or night. Plus, this hotel is perfectly positioned between the craziness of downtown and the serenity of Port Orange and Ponce Inlet. Last 2 nights we did stay in courtyard room (reg. room). That was pretty plain, but still good air conditioning and nice seating area right outside our door. Definite vacation spot, planning to return soon.

HotelInfo.Name: Dream Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3217 South Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach Shores, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
